name: Swissotel Sydney

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: we stayed for 5 nights in the swissotel sydney. It is a great hotel with a great location. Town hall station in a 5 minute walk, St James station is about 3 mins away. If there are two or more people it is probably cheaper to get a taxi from the airport. Our room was massive, modern and spotlessly clean.
reviews.title: Loved it

likes.disliked: — price of the in-house laundry!!!!

reviews.text: the only downside was having paid the hotel bill in full before our arrival, the reception proceeded to charge my credit card again. This was a major inconvience as we were at the end of our 3 week holiday and my credit card was near it's limit. The problem was eventually sorted after a few days but it prevented me from using my card during this time. Although helpful, I didn't even get an apology from the staff!
reviews.title: Centrally located hotel with cosy rooms

likes.disliked: — The price

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Swissotel is located in the heart of the shopping district next to the Sydney Tower. From the airport, I took the train to the Town Hall Station but the taxis I hailed refused to take me to the hotel presumably because of the short distance. It took me a while to locate the hotel entrance. A walk across Myers Department Store led me to the elevators which took me up to the front desk. Check in was done in ten minutes - five minutes waiting for my turn (it was nearly 7pm) and five minutes for the usual check in routine.
reviews.title: Plush and pleasant

likes.disliked: — Shaded pool!

reviews.text: My room, somewhat smaller than what I had expected, was cosy and inviting with wood panelling and furniture, and a wall mounted flat screen TV. I had expected picture windows but found apartment-type windows from which I could see all the hotel's neighbouring buildings (a bit too close for comfort). I liked the kimonos and the nifty coffee maker, but could not help comparing Swissotel Sydney with its sister hotels in Bangkok and Singapore whose rooms are much more spacious and had nice city views. Location-wise, Swissotel Sydney is like Swissotel The Stamford in Singapore, with shopping in the same complex but the latter's rooms all come with balconies with full length sliding glass doors, better equipped meeting rooms, an in-house convention centre and the subway at its basement. However, Swissotel Sydney has newer rooms/furniture and is just one block away from the monorail which serves the city centre. Both Swissotel Sydney and Swissotel Nai Lert Park (in Bangkok) appear to have been recently renovated but in terms of service, the latter stands out with its bellhops ever ready to lend a helping hand with luggage and hailing taxis, and smiling and helpful reception staff. Swissotel Sydney's staff were courteous and efficient but seemed to lack the X factor in making guests feel right at home.
reviews.title: 2 Star Hotel at 5 Star prices

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: I think Swissotel Sydney suits the leisure traveller more than the business traveller. Broadband speeds are excellent but the meetign rooms while ok are not impressive; to reach the business district or the convention centre, one would still need to cab it or walk to the train station and monorail respectively. For shoppers with spare cash to splurge on nice hotels, Swissotel Sydney is a good base to drop off shopping bags before continuing with more retail therapy. It is also within walking distance to Hyde Park if one needs a respite from the city bustle, and Darling Harbour, with its watering holes can be reached on foot or via the monorail.
reviews.title: great - clean, efficient & friendly

likes.disliked: — business facilites

reviews.text: I recently spent one night at the Swissotel in Sydeny and was very impressed with the overall experience. The room I booked was their "Standard" room but the room was anything but standard. The room was large with nice views of the city and comfortable beds. The bathroom was absolutely huge with a soaking tub as well as walk in shower. I ordered room service that evening as well and was equally as impressed by the food and service. All and all it was a class act. It's not over the top luxury but very pleasant and extremely clean. I would highly recommend the Swissotel.
reviews.title: Great Hotel in the Central Business District

reviews.text: I stayed in this hotel in early March, although the location is excellent, we will not return to this hotel. We checked in at 2:30pm and the room was not ready. The room is nice but it is dusty. We had breakfast there in the morning, the food was cold and not replenished, very disappointing.
reviews.title: Bad

reviews.text: What a treat! This hotel has class, style, modern design and delightful service. The location is very convenient to Hyde Park, Central Business District, Shopping and the bays of Sydney.
reviews.title: Class Act

likes.disliked: — Cannot open windows

reviews.text: I would return here in a heart beat.
reviews.title: Solid choice if you want to stay in the city!

likes.liked: — The value - Price/location/shopping (sydney tower a block away)
likes.disliked: — We did end up staying on Bondi beach which was a little more fun of an area

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed March 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The beds are firm but luxurious, with large down comforters and big pillows. The bathrooms are large, light filled and very modern. The carpets are clean and everything is well tended to. We also found the pool and fitness center to be state-of-the art.
reviews.title: Very nice stay...

likes.liked: — The upgrade to the Executive Club floor!
likes.disliked: — Not enough towels in the bathroom.

reviews.text: I've live in this hotel for 10 nights in the double-double room and it was a good experience! Room is very spacious as well as the bathroom. (including individual shower space&bath) The check in was processing quickly , staff are friendly and concierge was helpful. The location is excellent & the hotel did worth of money & the reputation i've heard from here.
reviews.title: Love it

likes.disliked: — concierge is seperated at the Ground floor

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: My husband and I had a get away from the kids for 2 nights and stayed on the executive floor to take advantage of the buffet breakfast and nightly 2 hours of canapes and drinks.
reviews.title: Great location, great service, We will be back

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: From the moment we arrived the staff were fantastic and our room was very nice. The hotel is very centrally located but the rooms are not at all noisy.
reviews.title: Great views

likes.disliked: — Tucked in off the street, need to take two lifts to bedroom floors

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The breakfast is very nice, all self serve and everything you need. Nightly canapes were ok but a little more variety would have been nice, again all self serve.
reviews.title: A good choice

likes.disliked: — tv was not a flat screen and was a bit small

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed February 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We will stay again for sure
reviews.title: Good location, great breakfast.

likes.disliked: — Check in was delayed and we had to keep coming back.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: My Boyfriend an I had a fantastic night at this hotel. The staff were friendly and helpful (special mention for Alan at check-in) and the room was lovely too. This hotel is located close to everything in the CBD and we had lovely views from our premier room on the 14th floor. The bathroom is huge and clean and has a separate large bath. The decor was simple and elegant. The only complaint was that the beds were quite hard. My partner and I prefer plush mattress's and pillows. Would defiantly go back again.
reviews.title: Loved it!!

likes.disliked: — Beds

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Had an upgrade to the Executive Club and had a great stay for 2 nights. Particularly impressive was their service for us. Location was brilliant for seeing some sights around Sydney - we walked to circular quay/opera house etc. in less than 15 mins , then caught ferry back around to Darling Harbour.
reviews.title: Lovely Service, Pleasant Stay

likes.disliked: — Executive Club Breakfast

reviews.text: We enjoyed the canapes :) Sausage rolls and curry puffs with drinks was more my style. I would, however, agree with some previous comments about the temperature and maintenance of food in the executive club - partic.breakfast. The loss of 1 star for the review is also because they forgot our turn down service on the 2nd night!!
reviews.title: Loved The Swissotel

likes.disliked: — nothing

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Would go back again though...
reviews.title: Best bet for value in Sydney

likes.disliked: — Nothing

reviews.title: Excellent
reviews.text: I love this hotel. I stayed 2 nights at the Swissotel at the beginning of the month on the 16th floor. I booked a package that included breakfast and what a breakfast. Something for everyone- from bacon and eggs to cereal. toast and fresh fruit. Everything was replenished as it ran out. .

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed January 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Superb hotel, right in the centre of it all but quiet and discerning at the same time. Sufficient facilities but everything they did, they did well - internet facilities, pool, awsome breakfasts! Friendly staff, especially Daniel (thanks for the tip about the cricket tickets - sorry you lost for a change). Lovely big, clean room with excellent shower and good views across to Darling Harbour. You can never get lost as the Hotel is almost directly under that useful landmark, the Sydney Tower. Beautiful Hyde Park is 200 yards away. Catch the explorer buses just around the corner. All famous landmarks within walking distance.
reviews.title: Spot On

likes.liked: — Accessibility and maintenance of good standards of service, facilities and decor
likes.disliked: — Front desk staff average, no sign of culture to go the extra mile. Rang ahead to arrange early check-in, but room was not ready for a further 2 hours!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed April 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: I booked this hotel for a trip to Sydney for my 1st wedding anniversary after reading good reviews on this site.. and I wish I hadn't bothered.
reviews.title: Don't bother.

likes.disliked: — Service, value for money, breakfasts, small rooms

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed April 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The only good thing about this hotel is the location, right next to Pitt St Mall (fantastic shopping!), near Town Hall Station and a 10 minute walk to the Rocks and Circular Quay, which is one of the most beautiful parts of any city I've seen.
reviews.title: Great stay, nice location for shoppers, easy access to all sites

likes.liked: — Contemporary, clean, up-to-date rooms - spacious bathrooms
likes.disliked: — We needed an early check-in (got in at 7 am) & had to wait 4 hours for a room

reviews.text: The worst thing about this hotel was the service. It was absolutely shocking, across all areas - and I'm far from fussy when it comes to service, promptness and a smile is all it takes to make me happy. The first offender was concierge.. we arrived quite late (11pm), lugged our bags inside, were not greeted at all and, without looking up, the guy grunted 'check-in is on level 8'. No offer to take our bags, no greeting, nothing. No matter who was there, they remained equally as rude and disinterested our entire stay.
reviews.title: Excellent

likes.disliked: — Room service was a bit pricey - but worth it

reviews.text: As New Year's is prime tourist season in Sydney, we managed to get a room here-better than nothing. It's in the center of town, several blocks from the harbor which is where most of the action is. From the street you need to take an elevator to the 8th floor, cross the lobby to another set of elevators to get to your room. Something of a hassle if you're in a hurry. If you plan to use their laundry services - beware. They charge $9.00 for one washer load...but the soap is free.
reviews.title: OK accommodations

reviews.text: Under different circumstances we would have picked another place closer to the water.
reviews.title: First Swissotel Stay and love it!

reviews.text: Our view - rooftops of the office building next door.
reviews.title: Good facilities and location, poor service

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We stayed at the hotel for seven nights while in Sydney on our honeymoon. We were not impressed. Although we got to check in early (6am), we were not impressed with our room, the staff or the service.
reviews.title: MONEY STOLEN FROM OUR ROOM

reviews.text: Our room overlooked a building site and so was noisy all day, everyday from 6am. However, given that the building work stopped at night we did not make any complaint in this regard.
reviews.title: Great Location, Excellent Hotel

reviews.text: On our first day we went down for breakfast at 10.10am. The breakfast service was due to finish at 10.30am, but we did not plan to stay beyond this time. Notwithstanding this, we were made to feel so unwelcome, being constantly hounded by staff as they proceeded to rearrange the whole restaurant layout around us for whatever function was being held there that day. We felt very uncomfortable.
reviews.title: Loved this hotel! Great location, quiet room, great view, lots of natural light - highly recommend!

reviews.text: On day three of our stay I became aware that money had been stolen from a purse left in our room. Although the purse had not been placed in the security safe, I was upset to find that someone had been through my personal possessions and stolen from me. However, what was most upsetting was the lack of concern from staff. Upon reporting the theft security staff visited my room, interviewed me and promised an update before departing – the update never came. Upon checking out, I left contact details with staff. However, one month on and I have still not heard from the hotel. I think that this is terrible customer service. At the very least, I expected an apology.
reviews.title: Great place, terrible staff
good value good location
reviews.text: In addition - although a minor issue compared with the theft – on one occasion we were left no toilet roll by cleaning staff. This was reported to reception. Four hours later and we had still not received any toilet roll and had to report it again.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: My wife and I both thought this is one of the best city centre hotels we have ever stayed in. Great location right in the centre of town just of George Street and opposite the Queen Victoria Building (QVB).
reviews.title: Excellent city centre hotel

likes.disliked: — the gym just a little too small

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed April 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Darling Bay 10-15 min walk
reviews.title: great suite!

reviews.text: The Harbour Bridge (The Rocks) 25-35 min walk
reviews.title: Excellent

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Town Hall 6-7 min walk
reviews.title: Excellent hotel and great location

likes.disliked: — Had to access room via 2 lifts

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Deluxe Rooms are excellent, (if possible ask for room 20 on any of the floors - it's the only one with a balcony). Plenty of space and well furnished. Bathrooms are also well equipped.
reviews.title: Nice Stay

likes.disliked: — There was just nothing special about the room... very ordinary and plain.

reviews.text: As wife was having a baby and we live in rural NSW we wanted to have a night of rest, so we booked a one bed suite so that toddler would have his own room (separate loungeroom) to allow us some privacy.
reviews.title: Wonderful

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Room was better than expected. It faced Centrepoint, but there was no noise. It may have been as we were on level 24.
reviews.title: Central and friendly

reviews.text: The executive lounge is worth the extra money. It was great, and we used it about 4 times throughout our stay. In the morning we grabbed some food and water and then we grazed there as we came and went.
reviews.title: great location

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: All staff were great, but sadly the Crossroads Bar and Restaurant let us down. This was our fourth stay a this hotel (our favourite) but EVERY time the bar staff and food staff are poorer than all the other staff. Why and how? Attitudes are poorer. Less able to serve and help. BUT, we just go elsewhere now, as the hotel is wonderful and housekeeping and desk staff are 5* all the way.
reviews.title: can i live here?

reviews.text: We are a couple without children, 33 years old, and stayed in Swissôtel Sydney for 7 nights end of Jul 2009.
reviews.title: Beware of the noise caused by nearby buidling site next to the Sydney Tower

reviews.text: I recently stayed at The Swissotel for the first time - and it certainly won't be the last. A girlfriend and I stayed for two nights and could not have been happier.
reviews.title: The Swissotel - For the First but Not the Last Time

likes.disliked: — Nothing

reviews.title: Great location!
reviews.text: Our rooms were on the 24th Floor with access to the Executive Lounge. The rooms were extremely comfortable with an expansive view over the city and a glimpse of the harbour.
Everything was spotless - especially the bathroom. There has been criticism of the hard beds but that did not worry me.
reviews.title: 5 star experience

likes.disliked: — Nothing

reviews.title: Overpriced, but nice.
reviews.text: We stayed at the Swissotel for four nights on our honeymoon in late September 2007. The hotel is very nice - the public spaces are beautiful, the workout room is very nice, and pool is great. The rooms are nice, but please be forewarned: The beds are as hard as a rock. I would honestly say that the bed was the least comfortable hotel bed that I have ever slept in. The view from our room was great - we looked out over the Sydney tower and one of the city's many parks.

We tried the breakfast buffet one morning - it was grossly overpriced. The quality was average, but the price was anything but average. I would skip the restaurant and the bar and find places that are a better value. (Actually, the food court next to the hotel has a great place for freshly squeezed fruit juice and there is another stand with decent muffins/breakfast breads.)
reviews.title: Greate Time

likes.liked: — the rooms are very nice and clean
likes.disliked: — comfort

reviews.text: Mostly i travel alot for work and i stayed almost every Swissotel in Europe that is also same standards of any swissotel in the world it was comfortable nice and relaxing holiday for me
reviews.title: great location

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Located near Pitt Street, this is a great location for walking to Darling harbour and circular quay. Minutes away from the monorail and train services.
reviews.title: Lots of little Pluses..well worth the money

likes.disliked: — Two lift system

reviews.text: The rooms are clean, well serviced, and the hotel staff are fantastic. The concierge helped us with everything, we didnt book anything, they sorted everything out for us, there opinions and facts proved very useful for our short stay in Sydney.
reviews.title: What a Beauty !!!

reviews.text: Just came back from 6 days in Sydney at the Swissotel.
reviews.title: Doesn't get much better - great value !!

reviews.text: There were many other more expensive hotels to choose from in the area, I think this one was a great gem and offered great value.
reviews.title: Can't get much better than this...

reviews.text: The hotel offered a great location, convenient to shopping, the monorail, train system, and an easy walk to the harbor and most everything else we wanted to do.
reviews.title: Great location, good value, expensive add-ons

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Being a first time visitor to Australia - the Conceirge staff suggested a great 1/2 day city tour that was perfect. It gave us the highlights of Sydney and was a good use of our time.
reviews.title: Great hotel, ridiculous fees.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed November 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The staff was extremely helpful - and when the bed proved to be too hard for my liking - they immediately offered to put additional foam top padding on the bed which was a world of difference...
reviews.title: 12 days of never needing to question the hotel selection, Priceless

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: This was for the most part a lovely hotel. I paid only £90 for the night and we managed to extend for the night for only £15 more per night. The location is great, in the main shopping area of Sydney and next to the Myer department store (sadly they ditched the Grace Brothers name). The entrance and public areas were lovely and the staff helpful and friendly. The room was clean and contained the usual facilities expected of a Swissotel (espresso machine, good toiletries and decent TV). The room however was small and there was only one bedside table, which led my travelling companion being forced to use the window ledge instead. There were only two coffee pods but room service delivered two more when asked.
reviews.title: Generally lived up to the Swissotel brand

reviews.text: Although I did not use the gym and pool they looked clean and pretty good for a city centre hotel.
reviews.title: So disppointed after great reviews

reviews.text: I was slightly disappointed that the usual toblerone were not placed on the bed during the turn down service (maybe this only happened in exec rooms in this hotel). I wouldn't say it was a five star hotel (mainly room size) however, I would definitely stay again. Great value, clean and fantastic location.
reviews.title: Fantastic Stay

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: As I write this I am curled up in my Swissotel bed... that has no sheets. And thats after checking in to find that they had provided only one towel and there was no milk to make tea. Also - for a 5 Star Hotel - they only had 2 kinds of tea - Chamomile and English Breakfast. Even the 4 Star Hotels have at least 4 different kinds...
reviews.title: Excellent Rooms and Superb Location

reviews.text: But on to the good stuff - the location is phenomenal, smack bang in the middle of the city - with Myer on one side and David Jones on the other - you could not ask for better location.
reviews.title: Great hotel, look no further

description: Swissotel Sydney enjoys prime location in the heart of the city centre, appealing to discerning business and leisure travellers. The deluxe 5-star hotel features 359 luxurious rooms and suites, a new exclusive Executive Lounge, two newly renovated stylish food and beverage outlets, extensive renovated conference and banquet facilities, and relaxing recreational and fitness facilities.
